4
5 Errors and warnings... */

36#include <sys/cdefs.h>
37__RCSID("$NetBSD: errwarn.c,v 1.2 2018/04/07 22:37:30 christos Exp $");
38
39#include "dhcpd.h"
40
41#include <omapip/omapip_p.h>
42#include <errno.h>
43#include <syslog.h>
44
45#ifdef DEBUG
46int log_perror = -1;
47#else
48int log_perror = 1;
49#endif
50void (*log_cleanup) (void);
51
52#define CVT_BUF_MAX 1023
53static char mbuf [CVT_BUF_MAX + 1];
54static char fbuf [CVT_BUF_MAX + 1];
55
56/* Log an error message, then exit... */
57
58void log_fatal (const char * fmt, ... )
59{
60 va_list list;
61
62 do_percentm (fbuf, fmt);
63
64 /* %Audit% This is log output. %2004.06.17,Safe%
65 * If we truncate we hope the user can get a hint from the log.
66 */
67 va_start (list, fmt);
68 vsnprintf (mbuf, sizeof mbuf, fbuf, list);
69 va_end (list);
70
71#ifndef DEBUG
72 syslog (LOG_ERR, "%s", mbuf);
73#endif
74
75 /* Also log it to stderr? */
76 if (log_perror) {
77 IGNORE_RET (write (STDERR_FILENO, mbuf, strlen (mbuf)));
78 IGNORE_RET (write (STDERR_FILENO, "\n", 1));
79 }
80
81 log_error ("%s", "");
82 log_error ("If you think you have received this message due to a bug rather");
83 log_error ("than a configuration issue please read the section on submitting");
84 log_error ("bugs on either our web page at www.isc.org or in the README file");
85 log_error ("before submitting a bug. These pages explain the proper");
86 log_error ("process and the information we find helpful for debugging.");
87 log_error ("%s", "");
88 log_error ("exiting.");
89
90 if (log_cleanup)
91 (*log_cleanup) ();
92 exit (1);
93}
94
95/* Log an error message... */
96
97int log_error (const char * fmt, ...)
98{
99 va_list list;
100
101 do_percentm (fbuf, fmt);
102
103 /* %Audit% This is log output. %2004.06.17,Safe%
104 * If we truncate we hope the user can get a hint from the log.
105 */
106 va_start (list, fmt);
107 vsnprintf (mbuf, sizeof mbuf, fbuf, list);
108 va_end (list);
109
110#ifndef DEBUG
111 syslog (LOG_ERR, "%s", mbuf);
112#endif
113
114 if (log_perror) {
115 IGNORE_RET (write (STDERR_FILENO, mbuf, strlen (mbuf)));
116 IGNORE_RET (write (STDERR_FILENO, "\n", 1));
117 }
118
119 return 0;
120}
121
122/* Log a note... */
123
124int log_info (const char *fmt, ...)
125{
126 va_list list;
127
128 do_percentm (fbuf, fmt);
129
130 /* %Audit% This is log output. %2004.06.17,Safe%
131 * If we truncate we hope the user can get a hint from the log.
132 */
133 va_start (list, fmt);
134 vsnprintf (mbuf, sizeof mbuf, fbuf, list);
135 va_end (list);
136
137#ifndef DEBUG
138 syslog (LOG_INFO, "%s", mbuf);
139#endif
140
141 if (log_perror) {
142 IGNORE_RET (write (STDERR_FILENO, mbuf, strlen (mbuf)));
143 IGNORE_RET (write (STDERR_FILENO, "\n", 1));
144 }
145
146 return 0;
147}
148
149/* Log a debug message... */
150
151int log_debug (const char *fmt, ...)
152{
153 va_list list;
154
155 do_percentm (fbuf, fmt);
156
157 /* %Audit% This is log output. %2004.06.17,Safe%
158 * If we truncate we hope the user can get a hint from the log.
159 */
160 va_start (list, fmt);
161 vsnprintf (mbuf, sizeof mbuf, fbuf, list);
162 va_end (list);
163
164#ifndef DEBUG
165 syslog (LOG_DEBUG, "%s", mbuf);
166#endif
167
168 if (log_perror) {
169 IGNORE_RET (write (STDERR_FILENO, mbuf, strlen (mbuf)));
170 IGNORE_RET (write (STDERR_FILENO, "\n", 1));
171 }
172
173 return 0;
174}
175
176/* Find %m in the input string and substitute an error message string. */
177
178void do_percentm (obuf, ibuf)
179 char *obuf;
180 const char *ibuf;
181{
182 const char *s = ibuf;
183 char *p = obuf;
184 int infmt = 0;
185 const char *m;
186 int len = 0;
187
188 while (*s) {
189 if (infmt) {
190 if (*s == 'm') {
191#ifndef __CYGWIN32__
192 m = strerror (errno);
193#else
194 m = pWSAError ();
195#endif
196 if (!m)
197 m = "<unknown error>";
198 len += strlen (m);
199 if (len > CVT_BUF_MAX)
200 goto out;
201 strcpy (p - 1, m);
202 p += strlen (p);
203 ++s;
204 } else {
205 if (++len > CVT_BUF_MAX)
206 goto out;
207 *p++ = *s++;
208 }
209 infmt = 0;
210 } else {
211 if (*s == '%')
212 infmt = 1;
213 if (++len > CVT_BUF_MAX)
214 goto out;
215 *p++ = *s++;
216 }
217 }
218 out:
219 *p = 0;
220}
221
222#ifdef NO_STRERROR
223char *strerror (err)
224 int err;
225{
226 extern char *sys_errlist [];
227 extern int sys_nerr;
228 static char errbuf [128];
229
230 if (err < 0 || err >= sys_nerr) {
231 sprintf (errbuf, "Error %d", err);
232 return errbuf;
233 }
234 return sys_errlist [err];
235}
236#endif /* NO_STRERROR */
237
238#ifdef _WIN32
239char *pWSAError ()
240{
241 int err = WSAGetLastError ();
242
243 switch (err)
244 {
245 case WSAEACCES:
246 return "Permission denied";
247 case WSAEADDRINUSE:
248 return "Address already in use";
249 case WSAEADDRNOTAVAIL:
250 return "Cannot assign requested address";
251 case WSAEAFNOSUPPORT:
252 return "Address family not supported by protocol family";
253 case WSAEALREADY:
254 return "Operation already in progress";
255 case WSAECONNABORTED:
256 return "Software caused connection abort";
257 case WSAECONNREFUSED:
258 return "Connection refused";
259 case WSAECONNRESET:
260 return "Connection reset by peer";
261 case WSAEDESTADDRREQ:
262 return "Destination address required";
263 case WSAEFAULT:
264 return "Bad address";
265 case WSAEHOSTDOWN:
266 return "Host is down";
267 case WSAEHOSTUNREACH:
268 return "No route to host";
269 case WSAEINPROGRESS:
270 return "Operation now in progress";
271 case WSAEINTR:
272 return "Interrupted function call";
273 case WSAEINVAL:
274 return "Invalid argument";
275 case WSAEISCONN:
276 return "Socket is already connected";
277 case WSAEMFILE:
278 return "Too many open files";
279 case WSAEMSGSIZE:
280 return "Message too long";
281 case WSAENETDOWN:
282 return "Network is down";
283 case WSAENETRESET:
284 return "Network dropped connection on reset";
285 case WSAENETUNREACH:
286 return "Network is unreachable";
287 case WSAENOBUFS:
288 return "No buffer space available";
289 case WSAENOPROTOOPT:
290 return "Bad protocol option";
291 case WSAENOTCONN:
292 return "Socket is not connected";
293 case WSAENOTSOCK:
294 return "Socket operation on non-socket";
295 case WSAEOPNOTSUPP:
296 return "Operation not supported";
297 case WSAEPFNOSUPPORT:
298 return "Protocol family not supported";
299 case WSAEPROCLIM:
300 return "Too many processes";
301 case WSAEPROTONOSUPPORT:
302 return "Protocol not supported";
303 case WSAEPROTOTYPE:
304 return "Protocol wrong type for socket";
305 case WSAESHUTDOWN:
306 return "Cannot send after socket shutdown";
307 case WSAESOCKTNOSUPPORT:
308 return "Socket type not supported";
309 case WSAETIMEDOUT:
310 return "Connection timed out";
311 case WSAEWOULDBLOCK:
312 return "Resource temporarily unavailable";
313 case WSAHOST_NOT_FOUND:
314 return "Host not found";
315#if 0
316 case WSA_INVALID_HANDLE:
317 return "Specified event object handle is invalid";
318 case WSA_INVALID_PARAMETER:
319 return "One or more parameters are invalid";
320 case WSAINVALIDPROCTABLE:
321 return "Invalid procedure table from service provider";
322 case WSAINVALIDPROVIDER:
323 return "Invalid service provider version number";
324 case WSA_IO_PENDING:
325 return "Overlapped operations will complete later";
326 case WSA_IO_INCOMPLETE:
327 return "Overlapped I/O event object not in signaled state";
328 case WSA_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY:
329 return "Insufficient memory available";
330#endif
331 case WSANOTINITIALISED:
332 return "Successful WSAStartup not yet performer";
333 case WSANO_DATA:
334 return "Valid name, no data record of requested type";
335 case WSANO_RECOVERY:
336 return "This is a non-recoverable error";
337#if 0
338 case WSAPROVIDERFAILEDINIT:
339 return "Unable to initialize a service provider";
340 case WSASYSCALLFAILURE:
341 return "System call failure";
342#endif
343 case WSASYSNOTREADY:
344 return "Network subsystem is unavailable";
345 case WSATRY_AGAIN:
346 return "Non-authoritative host not found";
347 case WSAVERNOTSUPPORTED:
348 return "WINSOCK.DLL version out of range";
349 case WSAEDISCON:
350 return "Graceful shutdown in progress";
351#if 0
352 case WSA_OPERATION_ABORTED:
353 return "Overlapped operation aborted";
354#endif
355 }
356 return "Unknown WinSock error";
357}
358#endif /* _WIN32 */
